bill_title: create or maintain juvenile mentor programs and Court Appointed Special Advocate (CASA) programs and to make an appropriation therefor.
keywords: Department of Education and Cultural Affairs

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to create or maintain juvenile mentor programs and Court Appointed Special Advocate (CASA) programs and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Thereby is hereby appropriated from the youth at risk trust fund interest the sum of five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Education to provide funds to create or maintain juvenile mentor programs and Court Appointed Special Advocate (CASA) programs. Section 2. The secretary of the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs shall disburse fifty thousand dollars ($50,000) to the city of Huron and fifty thousand dollars ($50,000) to the city of Aberdeen to maintain juvenile mentor programs. Section 3. The secretary of the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs shall disburse fifty thousand dollars ($50,000) to any private, nonprofit incorporated CASA program upon proof of incorporation. Not more than four hundred thousand dollars ($400,000) may be disbursed under this section. Section 4. The secretary of the Department of Education and Cultural Affairs shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 5. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2001, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.
